info.description: The Smooch API is a unified interface for powering messaging in your customer experiences across every channel. Our API speeds access to new markets, reduces time to ship, eliminates complexity, and helps you build the best experiences for your customers. For more information, visit our [official documentation](https://docs.smooch.io).
info.title: Smooch

get.description: Get the specified app user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Send an image message to the conversation.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Get an auth code for facilitating a channel transfer

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Get specified app user's channel entity IDs.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Link specified app user to given channel.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Get specified app user's business system IDs.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

delete.description: Unlink specified app user from given channel.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Fetch link requests for the specified app user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Get the specified app user's messages.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Timestamp of message. The API will return 100 messages before the specified timestamp (excluding any messages with the provided timestamp).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Timestamp of message. The API will return 100 messages after the specified timestamp (excluding any messages with the provided timestamp).

post.description: Post a message to or from the app user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: messagePostBody
parameters.description:
Body for a postMessage request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on message type ([text](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#text-message), [image](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#image-message), [carousel](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#carousel-message), [list](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#list-message))

delete.description: Clears the message history for a user, permanently deleting all messages, but leaving any connections to Messaging Channels and Business Systems intact. These connections allow for the conversation to continue in the future, while still being associated to the same appUser.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Reset the unread count of the conversation to 0.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Notify Smooch when an app maker starts or stops typing a response.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

get.description: Get the specified app’s menu.
List all service accounts configured.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

get.description: Get the specified service account.
List the secret keys for the specified service account.

post.description: Create a secret key for the specified service account.

get.description: Get the specified service account secret key.

delete.description: Delete the specified service account secret key.

get.description: Get an account-scoped JWT for the specified service account secret key.
List all apps configured.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

parameters.name: serviceAccountId
parameters.description: The service account ID for which to list apps.

get.description: Get the specified app.
List the secret keys for the specified app.

post.description: Create a secret key for the specified app.

get.description: Get the specified secret key.
Get an app-scoped JWT for the specified secret key.
List integrations for the specified app.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
List of types to filter the query by.
More than one value can be specified through comma separation e.g. ?types=*twilio*,*line*.

post.description: Create an integration for the specified app.

parameters.name: integrationCreateBody
parameters.description:
Body for a createIntegration request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on integration type. For detailed instructions, visit our [official docs](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#create-integration)

get.description: Get the specified integration.

parameters.name: integrationUpdateBody
parameters.description:
Body for a updateIntegration request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on integration type. For detailed instructions, visit our [official docs](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#create-integration)

get.description: Get the specified integration's menu.

post.description: Create the specified integration’s menu, overriding the app menu if configured.

get.description: List webhooks for the specified app.

post.description: Create a webhook for the specified app.

get.description: Get the specified webhook.

post.description: Upload an attachment to Smooch to use in future messages.

parameters.name: access
parameters.description: Access level for the resulting file

post.description: Remove an attachment uploaded to Smooch.

_id.description: The app user's ID, generated automatically.

userId.description:
The app user's userId.
This ID is specified by the appMaker.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

conversationStarted.description: Flag indicating if the conversation has started for the app user.

credentialRequired.description: Flag indicating if the appUser is secured by a JSON Web Token or not.

clients.description: List of clients associated with the app user.

pendingClients.description: As clients, but containing linked clients which have not been confirmed yet (i.e. Twilio SMS).

id.description: An identifier for the client. Must be globally unique.

active.description: Flag indicating if the client is active.

lastSeen.description: The date time the client was last seen.

pushNotificationToken.description:
The GCM or APN token to be used for sending push notifications to the device.
Applies to only *android* and *ios* clients.

appVersion.description: A reserved string field for reporting the app version running on the device.

appName.description: Name of the app associated with the client.

isPaymentEnabled.description: Whether or not payment is enabled for client.

wifi.description: Whether or not the client has wifi.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

userId.description:
The app user's userId.
This ID is specified by the appMaker.

credentialRequired.description: Flag indicating if the appUser is secured by a JSON Web Token or not.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

authorId.description: The ID of the message's author.

role.description: The role of the individual posting the message. Can be either *appUser* or *appMaker*.

name.description: The display name of the message author.

text.description:
The message text.
Required for text messages.

email.description: The email address of the message author.

avatarUrl.description: The URL of the desired message avatar image.

received.description: The unix timestamp of the moment the message was received.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the message.

items.description:
The items in the message list.
Required for carousel and list messages.

payload.description: The payload of a reply action, if applicable.

displaySettings.description: Settings to adjust the carousel layout. See [Display Settings](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#display-settings).

id.description: An identifier used by Smooch for internal purposes.

type.description: An identifier for the channel from which a message originated.

title.description: The title of the message item.

mediaUrl.description: The image URL to be shown in the carousel/list item.

size.description:
The size of the image to be shown in the carousel/list item.
Only top item of Facebook Messenger carousel supported.
Choose from *compact* and *large*.

mediaType.description: If a *mediaUrl* was specified, the media type is defined here, for example *image/jpeg*.

actions.description: Array of [action buttons](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#action-buttons). At least 1 is required, a maximum of 3 are allowed.

payload.description:
The payload to be sent with the resulting webhook.
Required for *postback* and *reply* actions.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the action.

amount.description:
The amount being charged. It needs to be specified in cents and is an integer.
Required for *buy* actions.

currency.description: The currency of the amount being charged (USD, CAD, etc.).

default.description: Flag indicating if the message action is the default for a message item in Facebook Messenger.

iconUrl.description: An icon to render next to the reply option (Facebook Messenger and Web Messenger only).

uri.description:
The action URI. This is the link that will be used in the clients when clicking the button.
Required for *link* and *webview* actions.

fallback.description:
The webview action fallback uri. This is the link that will be used in clients that do not support webviews.
Required for *webview* actions.

size.description:
The size used to display the webview. Allowed values are ["compact", "tall", "full"].
(Optional) Used for *webview* actions.

extraChannelOptions.description: Extra options to pass directly to the channel API. See [Extra Channel Options](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#extra-channel-options-schema)

imageAspectRatio.description: Specifies how to display all carousel images. Valid values are *horizontal* (default) and *square*.

unreadCount.description: The number of unread messages in the conversation.

channels.description: An array of objects containing the channel type and the entity id.

type.description: The type of channel (ex. messenger, viber, twilio etc...)

phoneNumber.description: The phone number for a *twilio*, *messageBird* integration

address.description: The email address for a *frontendEmail*, *mailgun* integration

chatId.description: The chat id for a *telegram* integration

type.description: The type of the channel to link.

phoneNumber.description:
A String of the appUser’s phone number. It must contain the + prefix and the country code.
Required for *messenger*, *twilio* and *messagebird* linking.

address.description:
A String of the appUser’s email address.
Required for *mailgun* linking.

givenName.description:
A String of the appUser’s given name. Used as additional criteria to increase the likelihood of a match.
(Optional) Used for *messenger* linking.

surname.description:
A String of the appUser’s surname. Used as additional criteria to increase the likelihood of a match.
(Optional) Used for *messenger* linking.

subject.description:
Subject for the outgoing email.
(Optional) Used for *mailgun* linking.

skipConfirmation.description: (Deprecated, use confirmation instead) Flag indicating if the linking confirmation should be skipped.

confirmation.description: Allows you to specify the strategy used to initiate a link with the target user.

message.description: The message used to reach out to the user. Must be a valid message object as per the post message API.

businessSystems.description: An array of objects containing the business system type and the id.

type.description: The type of business system (ex. slack, hipchat, zendesk etc...)

channelId.description: The channel id for a *slack* integration

ticketId.description: The ticket id for a *zendesk* integration

roomId.description: The room id for a *hipchat* integration

conversationId.description: The conversation id for a *helpscout* integration

next.description: The URI for the next set of messages in the conversation.

role.description: The role of the individual posting the message. Can be either *appUser* or *appMaker*.

name.description: The display name of the message author.

email.description: The email address of the message author.

avatarUrl.description: The URL of the desired message avatar image.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the message.

payload.description: The payload of a reply action, if applicable.

text.description:
The message text.
Required for text messages.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

items.description:
The items in the message list.
Required for carousel and list messages.

destination.description: Specifies which channel to deliver a message to. See [list integrations](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#list-integrations) to get integration ID and type.

integrationId.description: The ID of the target integration.

integrationType.description: The type of the target integration.

role.description: The role of the actor. Must be *appMaker*.

type.description: The type of activity to trigger. Must be either *typing:start* or *typing:stop*.

name.description: The name of the app maker that starts or stops typing a response.

avatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the app maker that starts typing a response.

text.description: The button text of the menu item.

uri.description: A valid address, like http://smooch.io. Required for a *link* type item.

type.description: Can either be [link](https://docs.smooch.io/javascript/#links) or [postback](https://docs.smooch.io/javascript/#postbacks), which correspond to Smooch’s [link and postback actions]((https://docs.smooch.io/javascript/#action-buttons).

payload.description: A payload for a postback. Required for a *postback* type item.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more service accounts that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of service account records skipped in the returned list.

_id.description: The secret key ID, generated automatically.

name.description: A friendly identifier for the secret key.
A friendly identifier for the secret key.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more apps that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of app records skipped in the returned list.

appToken.description: The appToken, used to initialize the Web, iOS and Android clients and to make calls to the app user facing API.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.
Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.
Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.

pageAccessToken.description:
Facebook Page Access Token.
Required for *messenger* integrations.

appId.description:
Facebook App ID OR WeChat App ID.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

appSecret.description:
Facebook Page App Secret OR WeChat App Secret.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

webhookSecret.description:
Secret to verify webhooks.
Returned on successful *wechat* and *messagebird* integrations.

pageId.description:
Facebook Page App ID.
Returned on successful *messenger* integrations.

accountSid.description:
Twilio Account SID.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

authToken.description:
Twilio Auth Token.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

phoneNumberSid.description:
SID for specific phone number.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

phoneNumber.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Returned on successful *twilio* integrations.

name.description:
Name on the account.
Returned on successful *twilio* integrations.

token.description:
Telegram Bot Token OR Viber Public Account token.
Required for *twilio* and *viber* integrations.

uri.description:
The viber URI to find the account.
Returned on successful *viber* integrations.

channelId.description:
LINE Channel ID.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelSecret.description:
LINE Channel Secret.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelAccessToken.description:
LINE Channel Access Token.
Required for *line* integrations.

botName.description:
The bot's name.
Returned on successful *line* integrations.

encodingAesKey.description:
AES Encoding Key.
(Optional) Used for *wechat* integrations.

fromAddress.description:
Email will display as coming from this address.
(Optional) Used for *frontendEmail* integrations.

certificate.description:
The binary of your APN certificate base64 encoded.
Required for *apn* integrations.

password.description:
The password for your APN certificate.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

autoUpdateBadge.description:
Use the unread count of the conversation as the application badge.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

production.description:
Flag specifying whether the certificate is production.
Returned on successful *apn* integrations.

serverKey.description:
Your server key from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

senderId.description:
Your sender id from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

consumerKey.description:
The consumer key for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

consumerSecret.description:
The consumer secret for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenKey.description:
The access token key obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenSecret.description:
The access token secret obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

userId.description:
The twitter userId.
Returned on successful *twitter* integrations.

username.description:
The username for the account.
Returned on successful *twitter* and *telegram* integrations.

apiKey.description:
The public API key of your Mailgun account.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

domain.description:
The domain used to relay email.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

incomingAddress.description:
Smooch will receive all emails sent to this address.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

accessKey.description:
The public API key of your MessageBird account.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

originator.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

brandColor.description:
This color will be used in the messenger header and the button or tab in idle state.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

fixedIntroPane.description:
When `true`, the introduction pane will be pinned at the top of the conversation instead of scrolling with it. The default value is `false`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

conversationColor.description:
This color will be used for customer messages, quick replies and actions in the footer.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

actionColor.description:
This color will be used for call-to-actions inside your messages.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

displayStyle.description:
Choose how the messenger will appear on your website. Must be either button or tab.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonIconUrl.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of selecting your own button icon.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonWidth.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its width.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonHeight.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its height.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

integrationOrder.description:
Array of integration IDs, order will be reflected in the Web Messenger.
When set, only integrations from this list will be displayed in the Web Messenger.
If unset, all integrations will be displayed
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessName.description:
A custom business name for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessIconUrl.description:
A custom business icon url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

backgroundImageUrl.description:
A custom background url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

originWhitelist.description:
A list of origins to whitelist.
When set, only the origins from this list will be able to initialize the Web Messenger.
If unset, all origins are whitelisted.
The elements in the list should follow the serialized-origin format from RFC 6454 `scheme "://" host [ ":" port ]`, where scheme is `http` or `https`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

pageAccessToken.description:
Facebook Page Access Token.
Required for *messenger* integrations.

appId.description:
Facebook App ID OR WeChat App ID.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

appSecret.description:
Facebook Page App Secret OR WeChat App Secret.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

accountSid.description:
Twilio Account SID.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

authToken.description:
Twilio Auth Token.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

phoneNumberSid.description:
SID for specific phone number.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

token.description:
Telegram Bot Token OR Viber Public Account token.
Required for *twilio* and *viber* integrations.

channelId.description:
LINE Channel ID.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelSecret.description:
LINE Channel Secret.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelAccessToken.description:
LINE Channel Access Token.
Required for *line* integrations.

encodingAesKey.description:
AES Encoding Key.
(Optional) Used for *wechat* integrations.

fromAddress.description:
Email will display as coming from this address.
(Optional) Used for *frontendEmail* integrations.

certificate.description:
The binary of your APN certificate base64 encoded.
Required for *apn* integrations.

password.description:
The password for your APN certificate.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

autoUpdateBadge.description:
Use the unread count of the conversation as the application badge.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

Your server key from the fcm console.

Your sender id from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

The consumer key for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

The consumer secret for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

The access token key obtained from your user via oauth.

accessTokenSecret.description:
The access token secret obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessKey.description:
The public API key of your MessageBird account.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

originator.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. If unspecified the default trigger is *message*.

secret.description: Secret which will be transmitted with each webhook invocation and can be used to verify the authenticity of the caller.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. If unspecified the default trigger is *message*.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. If unspecified the default trigger is *message*.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

maskCreditCardNumbers.description: Flag specifying whether credit card numbers will be automatically masked if sent through Smooch.
